title: A virtual visit to 3 printing museums
content:
I am fortunate to live within half an hour’s driving distance of 3 great printing museums in Belgium. During recent visits I took some pictures and posted them on my web site. You’re invited to take a short virtual vacation and look around in the:  
- [Historische drukkerij](http://web.archive.org/web/20090801152113/http:/www.prepressure.com/library/fun/historische-drukkerij)  
- [Kaartenmuseum Turnhout](http://web.archive.org/web/20090801152113/http:/www.prepressure.com/library/fun/kaartenmuseum)  
- [Plantin-Moretus museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20090801152113/http:/www.prepressure.com/library/fun/plantin-moretus)

To wet your appetite, here is a little teaser.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090801152113im_/http:/typophile.com/files/museum_antwerpen_plantin_moretus_6_4685.jpg)

Enjoy!
author: Laurens

comments.content:
NIIICE!

Thanks for sharing Laurens. I want to visit the [Graphic Design Museum at Breda](http://web.archive.org/web/20090801152113/http:/www.graphicdesignmuseum.nl/en/home/4) as well, so maybe I can combine all of these special places on a grand tour...
I had hoped to visit the ’Nederlands Drukkerijmuseum’ in Etten-Leur next but after learning that they don’t allow photography, I now have my mind set on the museum in Maastricht.
